etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in John Woodall (1570–1643), surgeon. Alteration of alexipharmac (by suffix substitution), after e.g. diuretic, diuretic)

definitions: A medicine or treatment believed to protect against, counteract the effects of, or expel from the body a noxious or toxic substance, especially a poison or venom; an antidote; (in later use) especially a remedy for snakebite.

notes.text: Alexipharmics were originally used in the treatment of many infectious diseases, including plague and smallpox.

definitions: That acts as an alexipharmic; of or relating to the action of an alexipharmic.
